titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green, to Henry Moore, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter covers several things:the need for trankeys to assist in the attack on Carrack [Kharg Island] and suggests why the Bushire Sheikhs are resisting to assist in this way;an account is given by Lieutenant Field of the loss of two trankeys when the Wolfewas caught in a storm and was forced to return to Bushire;the argument against removing the Company's effects so soon is made, fearing it may upset Carim Caun [Karim Khan] and the Sheikhs of Bushire at this crucial time;an urgent request for cash is submitted due to the factory being in debt;it is reported that John Hermit, the Bushire doctor, has died;a postscript, dated 17 May 1768, gives details of a packet received and the purchase of boats at Bushire that will join the fleet at Kharg.
